descript.abstract: Clackamas, Clark, Multnomah, Washington, Polk, Columbia, Marion and Yamhill county boundaries in Oregon and Clark county boundary in Washington.
descript.supplinf: Not applicable; File was created using a variety of local and state data sources. File and composition methods were reviewed by local data partners in July, 2010. Note that positional accuracy of the file may vary depending on the available data used.

idinfo.useconst: For product terms and conditions, please see http://www.oregonmetro.gov/index.cfm/go/by.web/id=505

horizpa.horizpar: Registered to tax lots. Street center lines were digitized from aerial orthophotography at +/- 10 feet accuracy. Tax lots were fit to the street centerlines. Beaverton, Oregon City and Tigard planning areas were improved to +/- 5 feet accuracy. Multnomah County was created with coordinate geometry using better control.

procstep.procdesc: County lines were digitized by ODOT as part of their detailed street base. Source was USGS quad sheets. Metro converted the layer to ARC/INFO format.
Registered to the tax lot layer.
Projection information (.prj file), compatible with ArcGIS 8.1, was added to the layer.
Positinal adjust of the Washington County Boundary to register to their positionally more accurate parcel lines. Edge matched at Clackamas and Multnomah County Boundaries.
County attribute changed to show county name only. "Co." was removed.
Changed native SDE storage precision from low to high
-Extensive boundary edits based on data submitted from local and state agencies -Added additional counties (Polk, Marion, Columbia, and Yamhill) -Peer review conducted with local data partners

County lines following the boundary between the states of Oregon and Washington were updated to precise state boundary line coordinates. The boundary between Oregon and Washington is defined by ORS 186.520 which lists latitude and longitude coordinate stations connected by a series of straight lines along length of the boundary.

distinfo.distliab: The information in this file was derived from digital databases on Metro's GIS. Care was taken in the creation of this file. Metro cannot accept any responsibility for errors, omissions, or positional accuracy. There are no warranties, expressed or implied.

digtinfo.formname: Shapefile or ESRI geodatabase format. Hourly fee will be charged for conversion

onlinopt.accinstr: Most RLIS layers are available on the RLIS Discovery site. Email drc@oregonmetro.gov or call 503 797-1742 for further instructions.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
